org.modelio.api.ui.text

Class TextWrapperForIElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.ui.text.TextWrapperForIElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPickingClient, IEditorDropClient

    public class TextWrapperForIElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPickingClient, IEditorDropClient
    Reusable component wrapping an SWT Text widget (because inheriting from Text is not possible) to add the Ctrl+Space auto-completion, the picking mode and the droppable features associated with the edition of a model element.

      • setElement

        @Deprecated
public boolean setElement(MObject target)
        Deprecated. Do not use this method to initialize the field value programmatically, it will fire the field listeners that may modify the underlying model. Use setSelectedElement(MObject) instead.
        Set the field value to the given element and end the picking session if the given element is valid.

        Warning

        Do not use this method to initialize the field value programmatically, it will fire the field listeners that may modify the underlying model.
        Specified by:
        setElement in interface IPickingClient
        Parameters:
        target - The new represented element in the field
        Returns:
        true if the new value is valid, false in the other case.
        See Also:
        setSelectedElement(MObject)

      • setSelectedElement

        public boolean setSelectedElement(MObject target)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the field value to the given element, if the given element is valid.

        Warning

        Use this method to initialize the field value programmatically, it won't fire the field listeners.
        Parameters:
        target - The new represented element in the field
        Returns:
        true if the new value is valid, false in the other case.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter value is not accepted by the field.
        Since:
        4.1
        See Also:
        setElement(MObject)
